meanings.def: very bad or unpleasant; used to describe something that you do not like
examples: What horrible weather!
The coffee tasted absolutely horrible.
a horrible mess/smell/noise
I've got a horrible feeling she lied to us.
I feel horrible about what happened.
He looks horrible with that new haircut.
He admits that he made a horrible mistake when he left her.
it is horrible to do something It was horrible to have to leave my family behind.
it is horrible doing something It was horrible sitting there all on my own.
What terrible news!
That’s a terrible thing to say!
That’s an awful colour.
The weather last summer was awful.
The coffee tasted horrible.
What dreadful weather!
There was a vile smell coming from the room.
He was in a vile mood.
The traffic around the city was horrendous.

meanings.def: making you feel very shocked and frightened
examples: a pretty horrible experience
a horrible crime/death/nightmare
a horrible tragedy/accident
a truly horrible sight
She woke from a horrible nightmare.
a horrible person
What a horrible thing to say!
horrible to somebody My sister was being horrible to me all day.
